note.p: Birth: Greenock, South Clyde, Scotland (19 January 1736)
Death: Heathfield, Birmingham (25 August 1819)
Burial: St Mary's Church, Handsworth, Birmingham
Research Field: Chemistry, engineering

Career: Apprenticed to an instrument maker in London; Mathematical instrument maker in London; set up in business in Glasgow; mathematical instrument maker to the University of Glasgow (1757-1763); employed on surveys of the Forth and Clyde Rivers (1767); patented his idea of a steam engine with a separate condenser (1769); entered partnership with Matthew Boulton, Soho, near Birmingham (1774)
Membership: Fellow
Election Date: 24/11/1785
